metadata.titel_preek: The Song Of Moses And The Song Of The Lamb

kernfrasen: The LORD is a man of war
overthrown them that rose up against thee
mighty battle, raging through the universe
put to rout the armies of the aliens
battlements and all of their armory
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: MORAL AND COSMIC HISTORY IS WARFARE

kernfrasen: church has marched for twenty centuries
long journey toward the land of promise
put us on the right road
every crooked way will be made straight
economists of Pharaoh began totaling up
cheap labor is too important to slave masters
selling the country to foreign interests
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: SIN IS EXPLOITATIVE TRANSACTION / SALVATION IS DEBT SETTLEMENT

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: The church has marched for twenty centuries to the drumbeat of its music.

cognitieve_implicaties: Faith requires rhythm and collective movement
Stasis is equivalent to spiritual death
theologische_implicaties: The church is a mobile, historical entity, not a static building
ethische_implicaties: Believers must keep pace with the community
Worship is fuel for social action

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: Re-activates the auditory and physical sensation of a drumbeat to explain the necessity of music for survival.

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: Evil... keeps changing masks. It's hard to tell who it is because they put down one mask and pick up another.

cognitieve_implicaties: Evil is persistent but hides its true identity
Discernment is required to see 'behind' the surface
theologische_implicaties: Evil has no substance of its own; it must 'wear' human structures
ethische_implicaties: Do not be fooled by 'charming' appearances or religious rhetoric

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: Uses the concrete imagery of Mardi Gras to explain the fluidity of systemic injustice.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher successfully bridges the historical/political struggle (Moses) with the cosmic/eschatological struggle (Lamb) using the overarching metaphor of 'The Song' as a vehicle for deliverance.

incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: The preacher explicitly rejects the 'Marriage' metaphor for the Religious/Political right to avoid 'honoring' it, switching to a pejorative relational metaphor.
incoherentie_punten.entailment_conflict: Marriage entails covenant/sanctity; shacking up entails temporary/illicit behavior.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: Narrative integration where God's physical intervention (winds) resolves the military threat to the journey.

sterktes.beschrijving: Takes the 'Dead' metaphor of 'The Song of Moses' and revitalizes it by connecting it to the 'sorrow music' and 'blues' of the Black experience.
sterktes.voorbeeld: Music is the language which the soul turns to when ordinary speech will not carry the weight of what is felt.

risicos.beschrijving: Heavy reliance on 'Man of War' and 'Military' imagery can reinforce a violent conception of God.
risicos.voorbeeld: The LORD is a man of war... overthrown them that rose up against thee.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation may adopt a 'us vs them' mentality in social justice contexts.

sub_worlds: The Eschatological 'Last Page' of the arithmetic book

deictic_shifts.locatie: Transition from Pharaoh to the Voting Rights Act
deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: Highly effective in establishing the 'timelessness' of evil.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Repeated emphasis on God 'picking us up' and 'straightening us out' now.

verstoorde_schemas.vervangend_schema: Faith as Co-operation: 'Use what you've got!'

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strongly aligns with the 'Song' as a liturgical act of resistance.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the Military and Journey domains, framed within a larger 'Musical' meta-metaphor. It effectively uses CMT to map the historical suffering of Black Americans onto the biblical Exodus and the cosmic victory of Christ. The economic metaphors (Pharaoh's economists) provide a sharp, modern critique of systemic sin.

revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Deepen the source domain of the Lamb's vulnerability to contrast with the 'Man of War' imagery.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: Describe the silence and fragility of a lamb in the face of the 'red dragon'.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: The tension between 'God as Man of War' and the 'Lamb'.
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Explicitly blend the two by showing how the Lamb's 'victory' is won through non-violent sacrifice, redefining 'warfare'.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: Suggests that the people behind the masks are irredeemable 'demons'.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Balance with metaphors of 'blindness' or 'captivity' to allow for the possibility of the oppressor's conversion.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To ground the 'every valley lifted up' imagery in the labor of building a new society.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful use of cognitive mapping to make ancient texts vibrate with contemporary political and personal urgency.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: While an aesthetic analysis would praise the 'lilting' prose, CMT reveals that the 'drumbeat' metaphor actually structures the hearer's understanding of historical persistence.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Unlike Kolb's focus on the experience of the preacher, CMT focuses on how the 'Sea of Glass' and 'Chariot Wheels' create a mental simulation for the listener.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT identifies that the preacher uses the 'Arithmetic Book' metaphor to provide a cognitive 'shortcut' for eschatological hope (peeking at the answer).

appendices.notities: The sermon transitions from a 'Medical' metaphor (disease cured) to a 'Juridical/Economic' one (account settled) at the climax, showing a high density of target-domain mapping for the Atonement.
